New Records: Austria recorded their first win in a European Championship since 1978
The tournament is on course to match the Euro 2020 record of 11 own goals, the highest ever
Key Match Events: Donyell Malen scored an own goal to give Austria the lead
Cody Gakpo teed up Tijjani Reijnders but the shot went wide
Xavi Simons came on and made a difference with a cross for Gakpo
Memphis Depay scored a looping header after a cross from Gakpo
Simons found Gakpo again for the equalizer
Austria scored a beautifully crafted goal with Florian Grillitsch and Romano Schmid
Marcel Sabitzer snuck in to score
The Netherlands had defensive disasters allowing Austria to win
Pre-Game Insights: Ralf Rangnick's young, hungry Austria side storm past the Dutch
Austria's persistence and tempo were highlighted
Post-Match Reflections: Austria's victory was a transformation of their national team
Rangnick's impact on transforming Austria's team was noted
The result means strong teams like France, Portugal, Germany, and Spain are on one side of the knockout draw
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match had a high number of own goals, a trend in the tournament
The last time Austria had such a performance was in 1978
Austria's performance was a contrast to Manchester United's under Rangnick
Others: VAR review led to a goal being awarded after a disallowed call
